Detailed Description

Miscellaneous functions.

Miscellaneous functions.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum cvl_reduce_mode_t

The condense mode.

Enumerator:
CVL_REDUCE_MIN  Reduce to the minimum value.
CVL_REDUCE_MIN_GREATER_ZERO  Reduce to the minimum value that is greater than zero.
CVL_REDUCE_ABSMIN  Reduce to the minimum absolute value.
CVL_REDUCE_ABSMIN_GREATER_ZERO  Reduce to the minimum absolute value that is greater than zero.
CVL_REDUCE_MAX  Reduce to the maximum value.
CVL_REDUCE_ABSMAX  Reduce to the maximum absolute value.
CVL_REDUCE_SUM  Reduce to the sum of all values.

Function Documentation

void cvl_resize_seq ( cvl_frame_t *  dst,
cvl_frame_t *  src,
const float *  fillcolor 
)

Parameters:
dst The destination frame.
src The source frame.
fillcolor Color to fill empty areas with.
Resizes the frame src to the new dimensions of the frame dst. The frame data is treated as a sequential array with cvl_frame_size(src) elements. When resizing to a larger size, the new empty areas at the end of the array are filled with fillcolor, which must have 4 components. When resizing to a smaller size, the fillcolor parameter is not used.
The typical use of this function is to resize a frame to power-of-two dimensions, then process the resized frame with an algorithm that requires power-of-two dimensions, and afterwards resize the frame back to its original size.

void cvl_reduce ( cvl_frame_t *  frame,
cvl_reduce_mode_t  mode,
int  channel,
float *  result 
)

Parameters:
frame The frame.
mode The mode.
channel The channel(s).
result An array to store the result in.
Reduces the frame frame to a single value in the mode(s) given in mode. The channel parameter determines which channel will be used for reduction: 0, 1, 2, or 3. The special value -1 means to process all channels independently.
For example, channel 0 in mode CVL_REDUCE_MIN means that the minimum value in channel 0 will be computed. The other channel values will not be minimized. They will contain the values that the pixel with the minimum channel 0 value contains. All channels are minimized independently if channel -1 is chosen.
In CVL_REDUCE_SUM mode, all channels are always summed up independently.
The results are stored in result, which must be large enough to hold one or four floats, depending on channel.

void cvl_sort ( cvl_frame_t *  dst,
cvl_frame_t *  src,
int  channel 
)

Parameters:
dst The destination frame.
src The source frame.
channel The sorting key.
Sorts the frame src: The top left pixel will contain the smallest values, and the bottom right pixel will contain the largest values.
The given channel (0-3) sets the sorting key. For channel -1, all channels are sorted separately.
Source frames with format CVL_FLOAT must only contain finite floats that are smaller than FLT_MAX.

void cvl_quantil ( cvl_frame_t *  frame,
int  channel,
float  q,
float *  result 
)

Parameters:
frame The sorted frame.
channel The channel.
q The quantil.
result A buffer.
Gets the quantil defined by q from the sorted frame frame. q must be from [0,1]. If channel is 0, 1, 2, or 3, then a single float from the corresponding channel in frame is stored in result. If channel is -1, then four floats, one for each channel, are stored in result.

void cvl_statistics ( cvl_frame_t *  frame,
float *  min,
float *  max,
float *  median,
float *  mean,
float *  stddev,
float *  dynrange 
)

Parameters:
frame The frame.
min Pointer to 4 floats.
max Pointer to 4 floats.
median Pointer to 4 floats.
mean Pointer to 4 floats.
stddev Pointer to 4 floats.
dynrange Pointer to 4 floats.
Computes some simple statistics for the frame frame. The minimum, maximum, median, and mean values are stored in min, max, median, mean respectively. The standard deviation is stored in stddev.
The dynamic range of each channel is stored in dynrange. If any of min, max, median, mean, stddev, dynrange is NULL, then the corresponding computation will not be executed.

void cvl_diff ( cvl_frame_t *  dst,
cvl_frame_t *  src1,
cvl_frame_t *  src2 
)

Parameters:
dst The destination frame.
src1 The first source frame.
src2 The second source frame.
Visualizes the differences between two frames. The frames dst, src1, and src2 must have the same dimensions and the same format. The pixel values in the resulting frame will be the absolute of the difference of the corresponding pixels in the two sources.
This function is a convenience function for cvl_layer() with CVL_LAYER_DIFF.

void cvl_pyramid_gaussian ( cvl_frame_t *  frame,
int  n,
cvl_frame_t **  pyramid 
)

Parameters:
frame The frame.
n Number of pyramid levels.
pyramid Buffer for n frames.
Computes a gaussian pyramid with n levels from the frame frame. Level 0 will be a copy of frame.

void cvl_pyramid_laplacian ( cvl_frame_t **  gaussian_pyramid,
int  n,
cvl_frame_t **  laplacian_pyramid 
)

Parameters:
gaussian_pyramid A gaussian pyramid.
n Number of pyramid levels.
laplacian_pyramid Buffer for n-1 frames.
Computes a laplacian pyramid from the gaussian pyramid gaussian_pyramid which has n levels. The resulting laplacian pyramid will have n - 1 levels.
The values in the laplacian pyramid levels will be fitted to [0,1] for easier handling. Transform them using the formula (2 * (diff - 0.5)) to get the real differences.

void cvl_histogram ( cvl_frame_t *  frame,
int  channel,
int  bins,
const float *  min,
const float *  max,
int *  histogram 
)

Parameters:
frame The frame.
channel The channel.
bins The number of bins.
min The minimum value(s).
max The maximum value(s).
histogram The histogram.
Computes the histogram of the given channel in frame. The channel must be 0-3, or -1 to compute the histogram of all channels. The histogram will be stored in histogram, which must have enough space for the requested bins and channels. Frame values outside of [min, max] will be ignored. These values must be given for all four channels (if channel is -1), or for the selected channel.
